citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
Male dachshund #021 (Atlas) has not had his dental cleaning scheduled as guided by the attending veterinarian (AV) in
the March 2024 physical exam. His teeth were observed to be covered by plaque/tartar and one of his upper left teeth
was slightly loose when touched. Dental problems left untreated can cause dogs to be unhealthy and cause discomfort.
Ensure to contact the AV and have this dog's teeth evaluated and treated per the AV's instruction.
***Correct by 10/21/2024.
Two medications that have been used on dogs/puppies this summer per the licensee were expired: Ivermectin pour-on
(Exp 3-2024) and Metronidazole (Exp 2-2023). Expired medications might not work as intended or could make animals
sick. Ensure that expired medications are properly disposed and not used.
***Correct from 10/15/2024 forward.

A 52-day old puppy (#146) was transported and sold at a swap on 10-28-2024. To protect their health, puppies must be at
least 56 days old and weaned prior to transportation in commerce. Ensure that puppies are at least 8 weeks (56 days) old
and weaned prior to any transportation in commerce.
***Correct from 10/15/2024 forward.

The area where feeders are attached to the gate have metal rails that were cut for the feeder space and have edges that
were rough/sharp to the touch. Also, a broken flapper door for two poodles had edges by the hinges that had points.
Points and edges could hurt dogs. Ensure surfaces are free from sharp points and edges.
***Correct by 10/19/2024.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
n

narrative:
2.40(b)(2) 
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
Male dachshund #021 (Atlas) has not had his dental cleaning scheduled as guided by the attending veterinarian (AV) in 
the March 2024 physical exam. His teeth were observed to be covered by plaque/tartar and one of his upper left teeth 
was slightly loose when touched. Dental problems left untreated can cause dogs to be unhealthy and cause discomfort. 
Ensure to contact the AV and have this dog's teeth evaluated and treated per the AV's instruction.  
***Correct by 10/21/2024. 
 
Two medications that have been used on dogs/puppies this summer per the licensee were expired: Ivermectin pour-on 
(Exp 3-2024) and Metronidazole (Exp 2-2023). Expired medications might not work as intended or could make animals 
sick. Ensure that expired medications are properly disposed and not used.  
***Correct from 10/15/2024 forward. 
2.130 
   
Minimum age requirements. 
A 52-day old puppy (#146) was transported and sold at a swap on 10-28-2024. To protect their health, puppies must be at 
least 56 days old and weaned prior to transportation in commerce. Ensure that puppies are at least 8 weeks (56 days) old 
and weaned prior to any transportation in commerce.  
***Correct from 10/15/2024 forward. 
3.6(a)(2)(i) 
   
Primary enclosures. 
The area where feeders are attached to the gate have metal rails that were cut for the feeder space and have edges that 
were rough/sharp to the touch. Also, a broken flapper door for two poodles had edges by the hinges that had points. 
Points and edges could hurt dogs. Ensure surfaces are free from sharp points and edges.  
***Correct by 10/19/2024. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.

n
